channel.title: Really easy question on client side for 317
channel.description: When someone click save account, where is the account and password saved, in which files?

item.title: Really easy question on client side for 317
item.dc:creator: @k0_twin k0 twin
item.description:
@k0_twin wrote:

[quote=“xlogga123, post:4, topic:322986”][quote author=daved link=topic=419399.msg3081403#msg3081403 date=1262177224]
no… so let’s say you want to create a new account…you run the run.bat type in your account and password and then you want to save it, so you don’t have to type it all the time, so you go to the menu above the game, where there is Bots, cursours, music etc. And click Account save, and then, each time you run the client, your account and password will be already typed.
[/quote]
that doesnt work
on any client sorry[/quote]

Why wouldn’t that be possible?

Read full topic
item.source: Really easy question on client side for 317

item.title: Really easy question on client side for 317
item.dc:creator: @xlogga123 xlogga123
item.description:
@xlogga123 wrote:

[quote=“daved, post:7, topic:322986”]Fixed, it was in files/core/usersets.txt

Lock this thread if you have time, tyvm[br][br][size=1]Posted on: December 30, 2009, 07:00:05 am[/size][hr]Actually it sent some strings to userloader.java and i nthe userloader.java there was a Bwwriter which worked like the chat logs… and it saved the things to usersets.txt along with chat eff
ects and colors.

k :P[/quote]

Read full topic
item.source: Really easy question on client side for 317

item.title: Really easy question on client side for 317
item.dc:creator: @daved daved
item.description:
@daved wrote:

Fixed, it was in files/core/usersets.txt

Lock this thread if you have time, tyvm[br][br][size=1]Posted on: December 30, 2009, 07:00:05 am[/size][hr]Actually it sent some strings to userloader.java and i nthe userloader.java there was a Bwwriter which worked like the chat logs… and it saved the things to usersets.txt along with chat effects and colors.

Read full topic

item.title: Really easy question on client side for 317
item.dc:creator: @xlogga123 xlogga123
item.description:
@xlogga123 wrote:

[quote=“daved, post:5, topic:322986”]it does on the one that I’m using… [br][br][size=1]Posted on: December 30, 2009, 06:53:07 am[/size][hr]Check this then

[code]if (cmd.equalsIgnoreCase(“Save account”))
{
UserLoader.saveuser();
System.out.println(“Saving file”);

}[/code]
wtf lol on every single client iv used save acc won’t work…
i see ur code makes no sens
it wont save ur account

if it does try look in cache[/quote]
